name: A1.1
description: Learners can construct simple sentences using first group verbs, reflexive verbs, and basic negation. They can introduce themselves, talk about their family, describe people, and express preferences. They manage everyday situations like ordering food, shopping at a market, or making small talk. They can count, tell time, and handle basic interactions in a restaurant or during greetings.

name: A1.2
description: Learners expand their abilities to form simple sentences, ask questions, and use verbs from the second and third groups. They can navigate daily situations such as visiting a doctor, shopping for clothes, or dealing with administrative tasks. They are able to compare items, describe their job, book appointments, and discuss their living arrangements. Basic interactions related to health, work, and housing are manageable at this stage.

name: A1.3
description: Learners start using the passé composé with first group verbs and prepositions of place. They can discuss their hobbies, daily routines, and emotions, as well as navigate a city, ask for directions, and talk about their travel plans. They are able to describe what they did recently, manage their time, and engage in conversations about media, sports, and nature.
